pages.text: In their journey towards mechanization, the Ancients' first step was isolating Void Tension and focusing it on a certain item. This process is called $(bold)Void Focusing$(), and our recreation of their invention is the $(item)Ancient Oven$().

Void Focusing involves drawing energy from the Void and directing it towards a single object. Doing so causes massive load on whatever tries it, but the Ancient Oven's casing is durable enough to withstand it... somewhat.$(br2)Every time a Void Focusing process is finished, the Ancient Oven takes a small amount of damage depending on which item is created.

The Ancient Oven has $(bold)Dimness$() levels that indicate the damage taken. In dimmed stages, the top ring emits less light and the bricks become noticeably cracked. Additionally, upon a transition between dimness levels, the machine audibly degrades.$(br2)You must observe your Ancient Ovens very carefully, but don't fret, as there are means of repairing them.

By feeding natural resources into the oven, it seems to give back some power to the Void, reversing the dimness process and repairing the machine.$(br2)These natural resources include $(item)Iron$(), $(item)Gold$(), and $(item)Diamonds$(), each with their own times to complete and repairing value.$(br2)All of these resources output irrelevant earthly items, so it's best to filter them out.
